newsitem.title: UK: SkyePharma files Iopamidol application in US.
newsitem.headline: SkyePharma files Iopamidol application in US.

text.p: British-based drug discovery group SkyePharma Plc said on Thursday it filed an Abbreviated New Drug Application (ANDA) with the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for Iopamidol, an imaging agent.
Iopamidol, which is used in the diagnosis of diseases through X-ray imaging, is a generic alternative to Isovue, the company said in a statement.
The company's shares gained 3.5p to 90.5 by 0710 GMT.
SkyePharma's U.S. unit, Brightstone Pharma Inc, filed the application with the FDA.
Brightstone also agreed to a co-marketing deal with U.S. firm PolyMedica Industries Inc for Anestacon, an anaesthetic used in urological procedures.
The unit also agreed to a deal with pharmacy benefit manager Alagap Data Systems that will put Brightstone's products into the company's pharmacy programme.
Terms of the deals were not disclosed. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
